question:
Select the correct combination of mathematical signs that can sequentially replace the * signs and balance the given equation.
42 * 7 * 64 * 11 * 6 *4
solution:
(b)Using option B
42 ÷ 7 + 64 - 11 × 6 = 4
6 + 64 - 66 = 4
70 - 66 = 4 Hence verified.

question:
Select the combination of letters that when sequentially placed in the blanks of the given series will complete the series.
L_UA_Z_N_AP_L_U_PZ
option_1: P, N, L, Z, U, A, N
option_2: N, P, L, U, Z, N, A
option_3: P, L, U, Z, N, A, N
option_4: N, L, P, A, N, U, Z
solution:
(b)The repetitive unit is: ‘LNUAPZ’
The complete series is LNUAPZLNUAPZLNUAPZ
N, P, L, U, Z, N, A is the correct answer.

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.
Statements:
All polygons are angles.
All angles are diagonals.
All cones are cubes.
All cubes are decagons.
No diagonal is a cube.
Conclusions:
I. Some diagonals are polygons.
II. All diagonals are decagons.
III. No polygon is a cone.
IV. Some cubes are angles.
solution:
(d)

From the diagram, statement I and III are clearly true and statement II and IV are definitely false.

question:
Select the Venn diagram that best illustrates the relationship among the following classes.
Women, Researchers, Introverts
solution: (c)Women, researchers, and introverts all have a relation of ‘some’ with each other. So option c is correct.

question: Out of the total number of players, 100/3 % are in hotel X and the remaining are in hotel Y. If 20 players from hotel Y are shifted to hotel X, then the number of players in hotel X becomes 50% of the total number of players. If 20 players from hotel X are shifted to hotel Y, then the number of players in hotel X becomes what percent of the total number of players?
solution:
(d)Let the total number of players = 300x
Then players in hotel X = 100x and hotel Y = 200x
According to the first condition,
100x + 20 = 200x - 20
100x = 40 so, 300x = 120
According to the second condition,
Player in hotel X = 40 - 20 = 20
Percentage required = 20120 × 100 = 16.67%

question:
Select the number from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series.
24, 35, 51, 73, 102, ?
solution:
(b)First difference is of 11, 16, 22, 29
Second difference is of 5, 6, 7 next should be 8
So, 29 + 8 = 37 and 102 + 37 = 139

question: In a certain code language, 'PERMIT' is written as 'VVLNOG'. How will 'INERTIA' be written in that language?
solution:
(b)Logic: Even placed letters are coded as reverse alphabetical position and odd letters are coded as +6, -6, +6
Following the same pattern INERTIA is coded as I +6 = O,
N ↔ M, E - 6 = Y, R ↔ I, T + 6 = Z, I ↔ R, A - 6 = U
Hence, OMYIZRU is the correct answer.

question: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the letter-cluster that is different.
solution:
(b)Logic : -4 pattern is followed.
But a similar pattern is not followed in NJFA, F - 4 = B(Not A).

question: A cube is made by folding the given sheet. In the cube so formed, what would be the symbol on the opposite side of the ‘#’ symbol?
solution: (c)Opposite pair are & and #, % and +, $ and @Hence, & is the answer.

question: Four number-pairs have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the number-pair that is different.
solution:
(c)Logic is : a : a × (a + 1)
But a similar logic is not followed in 17 : 307 as 17 × 18 = 306 (Not 307).

question: In a certain code language, ‘AROUND’ is coded as ‘52182412144’ and ‘FIX’ is coded as ‘63624’. How will ‘PLASTIC’ be coded in that language?
solution: (b)Logic: Consonants are coded as per their respective alphabetical position and vowels are coded as double the reverse alphabetical position.So, PLASTIC is coded as 16 - 12 - 26 × 2 - 19 - 20 - 18 × 2 - 3 that is 1612521920363.

question:
Select the option that is related to the third word in the same way as the second word is related to the first word.
Depression : Mood :: Insomnia : ?
solution: (c)As depression is a problem related to mood, similarly Insomnia is a problem related to Sleep.

question:
Select the option in which the words share the same relationship as that shared by the given pair of words.
Horses : Neigh
solution: (a)The sound made by horses is referred to as neigh, similarly, the sound made by Ducks is Quack.

solution: (b)

solution:

question: Four words have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the word that is different.
solution:
(b)
Aptitude, Memory and Intelligence are synonyms of each other which shows how clever a person is. But weight is entirely different from the other three.

question: In which of the following years was the Planning Commission of India set up?
solution: (b)The Planning Commission was set up by a resolution of the Government of India in March 1950 with the Prime Minister as the ex officio chairman. Formulating a plan for the most effective and balanced utilization of the country’s resources has been one of its functions. It was scrapped in 2014 and replaced by NITI Aayog in 2015.

question: Baghmara Pitcher Plant Sanctuary is located in which of the following states?
solution: (a)Baghmara Pitcher Plant Sanctuary is located in the South Garo Hills District of Meghalaya. The sanctuary is named after a rare insectivorous Pitcher Plant that is endemic to this region only.

question: For which of the following franchise teams did AB de Villiers play in IPL 2020?
solution: (c) AB de Villiers is a South African cricketer. In 2011, Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) bought him for Rs 5 crore and the franchise has not released him since then. Therefore, in IPL 2020 he played for the team Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB).

question: Who won the Toyota Thailand Open Women’s Singles Title in Bangkok in January 2021?
solution: (c) In the Toyota Thailand Open women's singles final, Carolina Marin of Spain defeated Tai Tzu-Ying of Taiwan. Toyota Thailand Open was held in Thailand from 19 to 24 January 2021. Men’s singles was won by Viktor Axelsen (Denmark).

question: Who among the following won the ‘3rd Rabindranath Tagore Literary Prize’ for his novel ‘The City and The Sea’ in December 2020?
solution: (b) Raj Kamal Jha has won the Rabindranath Tagore Literary Prize 2020 for his book , The City and the Sea. He is a famous writer and chief editor of the newspaper The Indian Express.

question: In Leh, the first ever ice climbing festival was celebrated in ______ valley in January 2021.
solution: (c) In Leh, the first-ever Ice climbing festival was celebrated in Nubra valley. It was a seven-day event, which was organized by Nubra Adventure Club to promote tourism in Nubra valley.

question: Which of the following is NOT a town/city on the west coast of India?
solution: (d) Gopalpur is a coastal town on the Bay of Bengal coast in the Ganjam district of Odisha.

question: Which of the following places is famous for a copper mine?
solution: (b) Khetri is a town in the Jhunjhunu district of Rajasthan. Khetri is well-known for its Copper mines. It was built by and is under the control of Hindustan Copper Limited.

question: Which of the following is a process in which hot, less dense materials rise upward and are replaced by colder, more dense materials?
solution: (d) Convection occurs when particles with a lot of heat energy in a liquid or gas move and take the place of particles with less heat energy. The liquid or gas in hot areas is less dense than the liquid or gas in cold areas, so it rises into the cold areas. Convection explains why hot air balloons rise.

question: Gurdwara Patalpuri Sahib is located on the bank of river ______.
solution: (c) Gurdwara Patalpuri Sahib is located on the banks of the River Sutlej. Guru Hargobind Ji in 1644 as well as Guru Har Rai Ji in 1661 were cremated here.

question: Who among the following was one of the founders of the Hindustan Republic Association?
solution: (a) Hindustan Republican Association wasfounded by Ram Prasad Bismil, Sachindra Nath Bakshi, Sachindranath Sanyal and Jogesh Chandra Chatterjee. The most prominent of early HRA efforts is the Kakori Conspiracy case of 1925

question: Who among the following had written Kitab-ul-Hind that gave an incisive description of early 11th Century India?
solution: (c) Al-Biruni had written Kitab-ul-Hind which is a book written about the Indian subcontinent. Al-Biruni was born in 973 AD, in Khwarizm in present-day Uzbekistan.

question: Which of the following statements about Swami Dayanand Saraswati is INCORRECT?
option_3: He was the founder of Arya Samaj.
option_4: He was the founder of Brahmo Samaj.
solution: (d) The Brahmo Samaj was founded by Raja Rammohan Roy along with Dwarkanath Tagore and others on August 20, 1828.

question: ______ is the structural and functional unit of kidney.
solution: (d) The nephron is the functional unit of the kidney. It is responsible for removing waste from the body. Each kidney is composed of over one million nephrons.

question: In which of the following years was the Second Round Table Conference in London held?
solution: (c) The Second Round Table Conference was held in London in 1931. Mahatma Gandhi attended the Second Round Table Conference to discuss constitutional reform in India.

question: Electron-volt is a unit of ______.
solution: (b) Electron-volt is a unit of energy. It is commonly used in atomic and nuclear physics. One electron volt is equal to 1.602 ×10-12 erg, or 1.602 × 10-19 joule. The SI unit of Current is Ampere, Power is Watt and Potential difference is Joules per coulomb.

question: In December 2020, the Ministry of Home Affairs declared the entire State of ______ as a ‘disturbed area’ for six more months under the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958
solution: (a) The entire state of Nagaland is a ‘disturbed area’ for six more months under the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958 (AFSPA). AFSPA is an act of the Parliament of India that grants special powers to the Indian Armed Forces to maintain public order in "disturbed areas".

question: Who among the following replaced Morarji Desai as the Prime Minister of India in 1979?
solution: (d) Charan Singh replaced Morarji Desai as the Prime Minister of India in 1979. Morarji Desai was the 4th Prime Minister of India and served between 1977 and 1979. He was India's first non-Congress PM. Charan Singh was further replaced by Indira Gandhi.

question: Who among the following is a Padma Vibhushan awardee of 2021?
solution: (d) Sudarshan Sahoo was awarded India's second-highest civilian award the Padma Vibhushan in 2021 in the field of art. Sudarshan Sahoo established Sudarshan Art and crafts Village, Bhubaneshwar in 1991. The institution is a training and creative center for traditional sculptures made of stone, wood, and fiberglass sculptures.

question: Unique Transaction Reference number is a ______ character code used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system.
solution: (c) Unique Transaction Reference(UTR) number is a 22 character code used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system. A UTR number is a unique reference code that is attached to every transfer sent to India and the exact format of the number can differ according to payment method.

question: As per the Union Budget of 2021-22, how many regional national institutes of virology will be set up?
solution: (c) The central government has announced the setting up of four regional institutes of virology and nine Bio-Safety Level III laboratories. At present, only the National Institute of Virology is in Pune.

question: Which of the following has the same dimension as that of linear momentum?
solution:
(a)
Linear momentum is dimensionally represented as [M1 L1 T-1]. Momentum is mass in motion and represented as MassVelocity. Impulse is the increase or decrease of an object’s momentum. Therefore, the dimensional formulas of Momentum and impulse are the same. The dimension of stress is and its unit is Pascal; energy is [M L2 T-2] and its unit is Joule and the dimension of Work is [M L2 T-2] and its unit is Joule.

question: Who among the following was elected as the President of the Veterinary Council of India in January 2021?
solution: (d)Veterinarian Dr. Umesh Sharma has been elected as president of the Veterinary Council of India (VCI), his second term after a gap of four years. Shri Sharma had earlier served as the VCI president from 2014 to 2017.

question: Which of the following schemes is aimed at helping accelerate the uptake of broadband internet services?
solution: (b) The PM-WANI framework envisages the provision of Broadband through Public Wi-Fi Hotspot providers. It will consist of elements such as Public Data Office (PDO), Public Data Office Aggregator (PDOA), App Provider and Central Registry.

question: Which of the following is the application of sciences such as physics, chemistry, biology, computer science and engineering to matters of law and to the identification of various facts of civilian investigation?
solution: (c) Forensic science is the use of scientific methods or expertise to investigate crimes or examine evidence that might be presented in a court of law. Forensic science comprises a diverse array of disciplines, from fingerprint and DNA analysis to anthropology and wildlife forensics.

question: The income of A is 45% more than the income of B and the income of C is 60% less than the sum of the incomes of A and B. The income of d is 20% more than that of C. If the difference between the incomes of B and D is 13200, then the income (in Rupee) of C is:
solution:
(b)
Ratio of A : B = 29 : 20
Ratio of A+B : C = 5 : 2
Ratio of C : D = 5 : 6
On balancing the ratio A : B : C : D = 725 : 500 : 490 : 588
B-D = 88 units = 13200
So, 1 unit = 150
C = 490 unit so, 490 × 150 = 73500

side2side2 = 89 = altitude of∆ABCaltitude of ∆PQR
89 = altitude of∆ABC10.8
Altitude of ∆ABC = 10.8×89 = 9.6 cm

question: If cos2θcot2θ + sin2θ - 1 = 3, 0 < θ < 90, then the value of (tanθ + cosecθ).
solution:
(b)
cos2θcot2θ + sin2θ - 1 = cos2θcot2θ - (1 - sin2θ)
cos2θcot2θ-cos2θ on dividing the numerator and denominator by cos2θ
1cosec2θ-1 ⇒ 1cot2θ = tan2θ = 3
so, θ = 60°
tanθ + cosecθ = 3 + 23 = 53 × 33 = 533

question: Length of each side of a rhombus is 13 cm and one of the diagonals is 24 cm. What is the area (in cm²) of the rhombus?

From the diagram
AO =12×24 = 12
Applying Pythagoras in the △AOB
OB2 =132-122=52
OB = 5 and BD = 10
Area of rhombus = 12 × Product of diagonals
Area of rhombus =12 × 24 × 10 = 120cm2

question: Some fruits are bought at 15 for 140 rupee and an equal number of fruits at 10 for 120 rupee. If all the fruits are sold at 132 rupee per dozen, then what is the profit percent in the entire transaction?
solution:
(a)
Type I fruits are : 15 for 140 or 30 for 280
Type II fruits are : 10 for 120 or 30 for 360
Total of Type I and II are : 60 for 640
Selling Price = 12 for 132 or 60 for 660
Total profit = 20
Profit Percentage = 20640×100=318%

question:
Study the following table and answer the question:
The number of cars sold by dealers A, B, C, D & E during the first six months of 2018.

The ratio of the total number of cars sold by dealer B in January, April and June to the total number of cars sold by dealers A and D in March is:


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(a)
Total number of cars sold by dealer B in January, April and June = 600 + 580 + 620 = 1800
Total number of cars sold by A and D in March = 628 + 722 = 1350
Ratio = 1800 : 1350 = 4 : 3

question:
Study the following table and answer the question:
Number of cars sold by dealers A, B, C, D & E during first six months of 2018.

In July 2018, if the sales of cars by the dealer D increases by the same percentage as in June 2018 over its previous month, then what is the number of cars sold by D in July 2018?


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(c)
Percentage increase in June 2018 of D = 780600 × 100 = 130 %
Sales in the July 2018 with the increase in the percentage = 130100 × 780 = 1014

question: When X is subtracted from each of 19, 28, 55, and 91, the numbers obtained in this order are in proportion. What is the value of X?
solution:
(b) Let the number to be subtracted is x so,
The required ratio is 19-x28-x = 55-x91-x
On cross multiply
1729 - 110x = 1540 - 83x
189 = 27x
So, x = 7

question: The average of 28 numbers is 77. The average of first 14 numbers is 74 and the average of last 15 numbers is 84. If the 14th number is excluded, then what is the average of remaining numbers? (correct to one decimal place)
solution:
(b)
Total number = 28 × 77
First 14 number sum = 14 × 74
Last 15 number sum = 15 × 84
Let the 14th number be = y
According to question
28 × 77 + y = 14 × 74 + 15 × 84
28 × 77 + y = 14 × 74 + 14 × 84 + 84
28 × 77 + y = 14(74 + 84) + 84
28 × 77 + y = 14(2 × 79) + 84
28 × 77 + y = 28 × 79 + 84
28 × 77 + y = 28 × 77 + 56 + 84
So, y = 140
Average except 14th number = 28×77-14027
= 28(77-5)27 = 28×7227 = 74.7

question: Sides AB and DC of a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD are produced to meet at E and sides AD and BC are produced to meet at F. If ∠ ADC = 78° and ∠BEC = 52°, then the measure of ∠AFB is:
solution:
(d)

In △ADE
∠BAD = 180° - 52° - 78° = 50°
In the cyclic quadrilateral ABCD ∠B = 180° - 78° = 102°
In △ABF
∠AFB = 180° - 102° - 50° = 28°

cot 25°cot 35° cot 45° tan 25° tan35°

1 × 1 × 1 = 1

question:
Study the table and answer the question.
Table shows District-wise data of the number of primary school teachers posted in schools of a city.

What is the ratio of the number of male teachers to the number of female teachers in the city?
solution:
(d)
Total males = 1650 + 1075 + 1280 + 1170 + 690 = 5865
Total females = 2375 + 2651 + 1520 + 1085 + 859 = 8490
Required Ratio = 5865 : 8490 = 391 : 566

question: cosecθcosecθ-1 + cosecθcosecθ+1 - tan2θ, 0 < θ < 90
solution:

question: If the 5-digit number 676xy is divisible by 3, 7 and 11, then what is the value of (3x - 5y)?
solution:
(c)For a number to be divisible by 3, 7 and 11 it should be divisible by 231
And on dividing 67600 by 231 we get remainder as 148
So the next multiple is at the distance of 231 - 148 = 83
The next multiple is 67600 + 83 = 67683
So, x = 8 and y = 3
3x - 5y = 24 -15 = 9

question: A chord 21 cm long is drawn in a circle of diameter 25 cm. The perpendicular distance of the chord from the center is:
solution:
(d)

The perpendicular distance from the centre bisects the chord into two equal half
Applying Pythagoras in △COB
OB2 = CB2 + CO2
OC2 = 6254 - 4414 = 1844
OC = 46

question: Let ΔABC ~ Δ PQR, and = ar(∆ABC)ar(∆PQR)=14449. If AB = 12 cm, BC = 7cm and AC = 9cm , then PR (in cm) is equal to :
solution:
(d)As, both the triangle are similar so their area is in the ratio of the square of their sides
Side ratio of ΔABC : Δ PQR = 12 : 7
If AC = 9 then its corresponding side PR = 912 × 7 = 214

question: To do a certain work. A and B work on alternate days with B beginning the work on the first day. A Alone can complete the same work in 24 days. If the work gets completed in 1113 days, then B alone can complete 79thpart of the original work in:
solution:
(d)
Let the total work be 72 Units
In 1113 A worked for 513 days and B worked for 6 days
A’s efficiency = 3
Work left by A = 56 units
B completed the work in 6 days = 56 units
B’s efficiency = 566
Total time taken by B = 72566 = 72×656
To do 79th of the work = 72×656×79 = 6 days

question:
Study the table and answer the question.
In the table, production and sale ( in 1000 tones) of a certain product of a company over 5 years is given.

In which year(s) sales are more than 90% of the production?
solution:
(a)
90% production of 2015 = 90100 × 1250 = 1125
90% Production of 2016 = 90100 × 1400 = 1260
90% Production of 2017 = 90100 × 1450 = 1305
90% Production of 2018 = 90100 × 1500 = 1350
90% Production of 2019 = 90100 × 1600 = 1440
Comparing 90% production and sales only sales of two years 2016 and 2018 are greater than 90% to the production

question: A shopkeeper earns a profit of 21% after selling a book at 21% discount on the printed price. The ratio of the cost price and selling price of the book is:
solution:
(b)Let the cost price be 100
Profit = 21% of cp
So, SP = 121
Ratio of CP : SP = 100 : 121

question: If x + 1x = 4, then the value of x5 +1x5 is:
solution:
(d)
x + 1x = 4
so, x2 +1x2 = 42 - 2 = 16 - 2 = 14
x3 + 1x3 = 43 - 3 × 4 = 52
x5 + 1x5 = (x2 +1x2) × (x3 + 1x3 ) - x + 1x
x5 + 1x5 = 14 × 52 - 4 = 724

question: If x + y = 4 and 1x + 1y = 1615, then what is the value of (x3 + y3)?
solution:
(b)
1x + 1y = 1615
x+y xy = 1615
4xy = 1615, xy = 154
x3 + y3 = (x + y) (x2 + y2 - xy)
= (x + y) ((x+y)2 - 3xy)
x3 + y3 = 4 (42 - 3 × 154) = 19

question: The value of 20 ÷ 5 of 8 × [9 ÷ 6 × (6 - 3)] - (10 ÷ 2 of 20) is :
solution:
(d)
20 ÷ 5 of 8 × [9 ÷ 6 × (6 - 3)] - (10 ÷ 2 of 20)
20 ÷ 40 × [9 ÷ 6 × 3] - (10 ÷ 40)
20 ÷ 40 × 4.5 - 0.25
0.5 × 4.5 - 0.25
= 2.25 - 0.25 = 2

question: X, Y are two points in a river. Points P and Q divide the straight line XY into three equal parts. The river flows along XY and the time taken by a boat to row from X to Q and from Y to Q are in the ratio 4 : 5. The ratio of the speed of the boat downstream to that of the river current is equal to:
solution:
(c)Let each equal distance be 1 Unit
So, the time taken for 2 units downstream is 4 and 1 unit is 2
And time taken for 1 unit upstream is 5
Speed of the boat = x and speed of the current = y
Downstream speed = x + y
Upstream speed = x - y
According to the question
2(x + y) = 5(x - y)
x = 3.5 and y = 1.5
Ratio of downstream and current = 5 : 1.5 = 10 : 3

question: What is the compound interest (in Rupee) on a sum of 8192 rupee for 114 years at 15% per annum, if interest is compounded 5-monthly?
solution:
(c)
Total time = 15 months and 5-monthly is calculated so it has 3 compounding periods
Rate = 1512 × 5 = 6.25%
6.25% is a ratio of 1 : 16
Principle : Amount = 163 : 173 = 4096 : 4913
Interest 4913 - 4096 = 817
4096 unit is 8192 similarly 817 unit is 1634

question: If 8(x + y)3 - 27(x - y)3 = (5y - x)(Ax2 + By2 + Cxy) then what is the value of (A + B - C)?
solution:
(c)8(x + y)3 - 27(x - y)3 = (5y - x)(Ax2 + By2 + Cxy)
a3 - b3 = (a - b) (a2 + b2 + ab)
a = 2x + 2y and b = 3x - 3y
(a - b) = 2x + 2y - 3x + 3y = (5y - x)
(a2 + b2 + ab) = (4x2 + 4y2 + 8xy + 9x2 + 9y2 - 18xy + 6x2 - 6xy + 6xy - 6y2)
(a2 + b2 + ab) =(19x2 + 7y2 - 10xy)
8(x + y)3 - 27(x - y)3 = (5y - x)(19x2 + 7y2 - 10xy)
A = 19, B = 7 and C = -10
A+ B - C = 19 + 7 -(-10) = 26 + 10 = 36

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the right order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
A. When we got near, we saw it was the steam rising from hot springs.
B. We saw in the distance a great column of smoke.
C. We wondered if it came from a chimney or a burning house.
D. We thought of taking a bath in the hot water.
solution:
(c) BCAD.
Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. a great column of smoke. However, Sentence C states that they wondered if it came from a chimney or a burning house. So, C will follow B. Further, Sentence A states when they got near, we saw it was the steam rising from hot springs & Sentence D states that we thought of taking a bath in the hot water. So, D will follow A. Going through the options, option c has the correct sequence.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them contains an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options.
You must avoid riding in a crowded bus / or travelling in a metro / during rush hour / as both are quiet unpleasant experiences.
option_1: You must avoid riding in a crowded bus
solution:
(c) as both are quiet unpleasant experiences.
Quiet is an adjective that means with very little or no noise & ‘Quite’ is an adverb that is used for emphasizing something. However, the given sentence does not talk about any sound or noise. Hence, ‘both are quite unpleasant experiences’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Generic
solution:
(d)Universal - connected with, done by, or affecting everyone in the world or everyone in a particular group or widespread or ubiquitous.
Generic - common or collective or typical of a whole group of things
Specific - detailed or exact, particular or distinct
Precise - clear and accurate or explicit
Definite - fixed and unlikely to change, certain

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Work and domestic ______ made Kajal short-tempered.
solution:
(a) pressures.
Pressure means worries or difficulties that you have because you have too much to deal with. The given sentence states that work and domestic pressures made Kajal short-tempered. Hence, ‘pressures’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
Raise the bar
solution:
(d)Raise the bar - to set higher goals or to increase the set standards of something.
Example- The increase in the number of appearing candidates has raised the bar for the competition.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
A herd or flock of animals being driven in a body
solution:
(d)Drove- a herd or flock of animals being driven in a body
Crowd- a large number of people in one place or mob
Cluster- a group of people, plants, or things that stand or grow close together
Throng- a large crowd of people

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.
Had you /not reached in time, / we will have / lost our lives.
solution:
(d) we will have.
“Had + V3 _________ would have + V3” is grammatically the correct structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘we would have’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
Bang for the buck
solution:
(b)Bang for the buck - more value for money.
Example- I didn’t get the bang for the buck that I expected on the sale of my car.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Gradual
solution:
(a)Abrupt - sudden and unexpected; rapid
Gradual - happening slowly or over a long period of time; not sudden; bit by bit
Regular - having the same amount of space or time between each thing or part
Gentle - kind and calm.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If no substitution is required, select ‘No substitution’.
The toy drummerplays the drum if you pressthe button at the back.
option_1: played the drum if you are pressing
option_4: will play the drum if you will press
solution:
(b) No substitution.
The sentence is grammatically correct.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
A group of three novels or plays, each complete in itself
solution:
(d)Trilogy - a group of three novels or plays, each complete in itself.
Triplet - one of three children or animals that are born to one mother at the same time.
Triumvir - each of three public officers jointly responsible for overseeing any of the administrative departments.
Trivet - an iron tripod or bracket for a cooking pot or kettle to stand on.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Seize
solution:
(c)Loosen - to become or make something less tight
Seize - to take hold of something suddenly and firmly or to grab something
Catch - to take hold of something that is moving, usually with your hand or hands
Grab - to take something with a sudden movement
Snatch - to take something with a quick rough movement .

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Regime
solution:
(b)Rule- control of or dominion over an area or people; jurisdiction, administration
Regime- a method or system of government, especially one that has not been elected in a fair way
Territory- an area of land that belongs to one country
Space- a place or an area that is empty or not used
Country- a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the right order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
A. But the eagle, in wrath, gave the beetle a flap of his wing, and straightaway seized upon the hare and devoured him.
B. The beetle therefore interceded with the eagle, begging of him not to kill the poor suppliant, and pleaded with him not to kill so small an animal.
C. When the eagle flew away, the beetle flew after him, to learn where his nest was.
D. A hare, being pursued by an eagle, took himself for refuge to the nest of a beetle, whom he begged to save him.
solution:
(a) DBAC.
Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. a hare, being pursued by an eagle. However, Sentence B states that the beetle, therefore, interceded with the eagle, begging him not to kill the poor suppliant. So, B will follow D. Further, Sentence A states that the eagle, in wrath, gave the beetle a flap of his wing & Sentence C states that when the eagle flew away, the beetle flew after him. So, C will follow A. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
90. Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
India is formally moving ahead to ______ 21 MIG-29 and 12 Sukhoi-30MKI fighters from Russia along with upgrades of their existing fleets.
solution:
(d) procure.
Procure means to obtain something, or to buy or purchase something especially with difficulty. The given sentence states that India is formally moving ahead to procure 21 MIG-29 and 12 Sukhoi-30MKI fighters from Russia. Hence, ‘procure’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(d) Voilence.
‘Violence’ is the correct spelling.

question:
92. Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If no substitution is required, select ‘No substitution’.
While washing your hands, rub them together for 20 seconds to remove the microbes on them.
solution:
(a) No substitution.
The sentence is grammatically correct.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
“Everything is going to be alright,” said the doctor.
option_1: The doctor said that everything are going to be alright.
option_2: The doctor said that everything is going to be alright.
option_3: The doctor said that everything will be alright.
option_4: The doctor said that everything was going to be alright.
solution:
(d) The doctor said that everything was going to be alright. (Correct)
(a) The doctor said that everything are going to be alright. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) The doctor said that everything is going to be alright. (Incorrect Tense)
(c) The doctor said that everything will be alright. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The invigilator is advising the students not to carry calculators into the examination hall.
option_1: The students have been advised not to carry calculators into the examination hall by the invigilator.
option_2: The students were advised not to carry calculators into the examination hall.
option_3: The students are being advised by the invigilator not to carry calculators into the examination hall.
option_4: The students were advised the invigilator not to carry calculators into the examination
solution:
(c) The students are being advised by the invigilator not to carry calculators into the examination hall. (Correct)
(a) The students have been advised not to carry calculators into the examination hall by the invigilator. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) The students were advised not to carry calculators into the examination hall. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) The students were advised the invigilator not to carry calculators into the examination (Incorrect Tense)

question: 95. Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b) Pieceful.
‘Peaceful’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Cloze test :-
What every tourist must take back from Bhutan is pure honey, especially Putka, “Antibiotic” honey produced (96)______ Melipona Bees (stingless bees) a breed found in protected areas (97)______ 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Due (98)______ their small size, they can get larger nutrients (99)______ regular honeybees. It has a tangy/sour taste and can (100)______ your sore throat in a matter of minutes.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96
solution:
(b) by.
‘By’ as a preposition means through doing or using something or by means of something. The given passage states that Putka, “Antibiotic” honey is produced by Melipona Bees. Hence, ‘by’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :-
What every tourist must take back from Bhutan is pure honey, especially Putka, “Antibiotic” honey produced (96)______ Melipona Bees (stingless bees) a breed found in protected areas (97)______ 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Due (98)______ their small size, they can get larger nutrients (99)______ regular honeybees. It has a tangy/sour taste and can (100)______ your sore throat in a matter of minutes.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97
solution:
(b) between.
Between means in the middle of two things, distances, places, etc. The given passage states that Melipona Bees is a breed found in protected areas between 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Hence, ‘between’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :-
What every tourist must take back from Bhutan is pure honey, especially Putka, “Antibiotic” honey produced (96)______ Melipona Bees (stingless bees) a breed found in protected areas (97)______ 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Due (98)______ their small size, they can get larger nutrients (99)______ regular honeybees. It has a tangy/sour taste and can (100)______ your sore throat in a matter of minutes.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98
solution:
(b) to.
The preposition ‘to’ always comes after the word ‘due’. Hence, ‘to’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :-
What every tourist must take back from Bhutan is pure honey, especially Putka, “Antibiotic” honey produced (96)______ Melipona Bees (stingless bees) a breed found in protected areas (97)______ 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Due (98)______ their small size, they can get larger nutrients (99)______ regular honeybees. It has a tangy/sour taste and can (100)______ your sore throat in a matter of minutes.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(c) than.
We generally use ‘than’ when we do a comparison between two things. Similarly, in the given passage, we are comparing the Melipona Bees with other regular honeybees. Hence, ‘than’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :-
What every tourist must take back from Bhutan is pure honey, especially Putka, “Antibiotic” honey produced (96)______ Melipona Bees (stingless bees) a breed found in protected areas (97)______ 700 to 1,500 metres above sea level. Due (98)______ their small size, they can get larger nutrients (99)______ regular honeybees. It has a tangy/sour taste and can (100)______ your sore throat in a matter of minutes.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(d) soothe.
Soothe means to reduce pain or discomfort; relieve or ease pain. The given passage states that the honey has a tangy/sour taste and can make your sore(painful or aching) throat feel relieved of pain. Hence, ‘soothe’ is the most appropriate answer.
